text: Patricia Era Bath (November 4, 1942 - May 30, 2019) was an American ophthalmologist, inventor, humanitarian, and academic. She was born in New York City. She was the first woman member of the Jules Stein Eye Institute. She worked at the UCLA Medical Center. Bath was the first African-American person to be a resident in ophthalmology at New York University. She was the first African-American woman doctor to receive a patent for a medical purpose. She is the holder of five patents.Patricia E. Bath, Google patent search. Retrieved February 24, 2019. Bath died on May 30, 2019 at a University of California, San Francisco medical center from cancer-related problems, aged 76. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in San Francisco Category:American inventors Category:American philanthropists Category:American physicians Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City Category:University of California, Los Angeles faculty Category:Ophthalmology Category:New York University faculty
title: Patricia Bath
